posts.cooked:
Hello, I want to use a Joystick as a button by setting a threshold, at which point it will run a command.  What’s they best way to accomplish this?  I was going to write a custom trigger, but I can’t find a tutorial and I’m getting an error (described below).  I guess I could just put an if statement in the command.

Trigger Code: TriggerL2Button.java

Relevant Code: RobotContainer.java

Error-ing Code: RobotContainer.java

Error:

I don’t understand why this results in an error because SpinIntakeWheel is a command and TriggerL2Button extends Trigger .  I generated the trigger using the old trigger template and added the old WPILib library, but it’s the same as what’s shown in the current docs .

Link to project: FRC-Code-2022/src/main/java/frc/robot at fixingQuickTestCode · frc6506/FRC-Code-2022 · GitHub

Update: I get a similar error if I create an instance of a Command without setting it to anything and pass it to whileActive .

link_counts.title: Binding Commands to Triggers — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Greg
posts.cooked:
At a glance, my guess is an issues with the new vs old command-based frameworks.

You’re using edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Trigger , which takes in a edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Command https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/buttons/Trigger.html

I think you want edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger which takes in a edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj2/command/button/Trigger.html

It looks like you shouldn’t need to change much (if any) code other than the import statement in your TriggerL2Button.java .
